Attention, pantry pilgrims: The kettles beat like war drums and the air smells of rosemary and thunder. Doors rattle; shelves murmur; sacks of grain lean to listen. In the hush between ladle and flame, an oath is spoken that tastes like smoke and salt. And from that oath rises the Supreme Bean Overlord. They were not crowned in marble halls, but in a village kitchen the night the hearth-guilds failed and winter clawed at every sill. An apprentice cook-witch stirred the Common Pot until the broth sang, traced sigils in steam, and invoked the ancient Legume Riteâ€”Soak, Stir, Share. The beans awoke, each a bright little heartbeat, and the pot swelled with courage; from its brim stepped a figure in a can-crown, bearing the Master Spoon as scepter. Sprouts bent like pennons in a gale; the first oaths were sworn over bread and brine, and the pantryâ€”once a quiet room of keepingâ€”became a chapel of uprising. Word raced along roads and root-cellars alike: hoarded larders were broken, lonely fires rekindled, and the meek were provisioned in the Overlordâ€™s name. The war that followed was brief and boiling. Against the Salt Barons and their iron cauldrons marched millers, picklers, and fieldhands beneath stew-stitched banners; Slightly Larger Beans rolled like sling-stones; the Sentient Bean Collective hummed one stout harmony that made sieges feel like supper. By ladle-law the Overlord decreed: No grief in the garden. No false weights at market. No dupe of bread or bean. Consent in spice, kindness in word, and every pot with an off-switch. When the final lid clattered, a Commons Pot was raised at the crossroadsâ€”ever-warm, ever-watchfulâ€”so travelers might ladle hope without cost. And should famine or foolishness return, the rite endures: strike the Master Spoon thrice on the can-crown, whisper share the beans, and the Overlord will answerâ€”quiet as a simmer, unstoppable as a boil.
Higher than vanilla enchants! Last updated: Nov 8, 2025

Get the enchant.
Find a book or item with the enchant you want. You can get these from villagers, the enchanting table, loot, other players, or the AuctionHouse.Use an anvil to level it up.
Combine two of the same level to make the next level.Example to reach Sharpness X:
V (5) + V (5) â†’ VI (6) â†’VI (6) + VI (6) â†’ VII (7) â†’VII (7) + VII (7) â†’ VIII (8) â†’VIII (8) + VIII (8) â†’ IX (9) â†’IX (9) + IX (9) â†’ X (10)Put the book on your gear.
Use the anvil to apply the finished book to your tool, weapon, armor, or a matching enchanted book.Costs go up at higher levels.
If you see â€œToo Expensiveâ€:Unintended behavior. Report it to staff. Tip: The enchanting table only gives vanilla levels.
To go past vanilla, you need the anvil and book merging.
Legend: Max = highest level allowed on Runbad.Where = what item it goes on.Notes explain any special rules.(Runbad) = special server rule thatâ€™s different from vanilla.

EnchantMaxWhereNotesProtection10ArmorOnly one protection type per piece.Fire Protection10Armorã€ƒBlast Protection10Armorã€ƒProjectile Protection10Armorã€ƒThorns5ArmorHigher = more return damage (and more durability use).

EnchantMaxWhereNotesSharpness10Sword/AxeMore overall damage.Smite8Sword/AxeExtra damage vs undead.Bane of Arthropods8Sword/AxeExtra damage vs arthropods.Knockback5SwordPushes enemies back.Fire Aspect5SwordSets targets on fire.Looting6SwordMore mob drops.Sweeping Edge3SwordWider sweep damage (aka  in some configs).

EnchantMaxWhereNotesEfficiency10ToolsFaster breaking.Unbreaking10Most gearTakes durability damage less often.Fortune5ToolsCanâ€™t go with Silk Touch on the same tool.Silk Touch1ToolsCanâ€™t go with Fortune on the same tool.

EnchantMaxWhereNotesPower8BowMore arrow damage.Punch4BowMore arrow knockback.Flame1BowFire arrows.Infinity1Bow/Crossbow(Runbad) Bows can have Infinity + Mending together. Crossbows can use Infinity here.Quick Charge3CrossbowFaster reload.Piercing4CrossbowArrows pass through mobs.Multishot1CrossbowShoots 3 arrows (uses 1).Mending1Most gearRepairs with XP; allowed with Infinity on bows (Runbad).

EnchantMaxWhereNotesImpaling5TridentExtra damage vs aquatic mobs.Loyalty3TridentTrident returns when thrown. Canâ€™t go with Riptide.Riptide3TridentSpin-dash in water/rain. Canâ€™t go with Loyalty or Channeling.Channeling1TridentLightning in thunderstorms. Canâ€™t go with Riptide.

EnchantMaxWhereNotesCurse of Binding1ArmorSticks to you.Curse of Vanishing1Most gearDisappears on death. Quick compatibility reminders Fortune â‡„ Silk Touch: pick one per tool.Riptide â‡„ (Loyalty/Channeling): pick one path for your trident.Boots: Frost Walker â‡„ Depth Strider: pick one.Armor: only one Protection type per piece.Runbad special: Bows can use Infinity + Mending together; Crossbows can use Infinity.
